snippet: Actuaries normally toil far from the limelight, but their calculations are feeding a roaring national debate over insurance premiums and the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Actuaries at top-rated Geisinger Health Plan in Pennsylvania have requested 40 percent rate increase for people buying insurance under Affordable Care Act in 2017, to dismay of consumer advocates; request has placed ordinarily quiet professionals at center of ongoing debate over health reform law.
lead_paragraph: Actuaries normally toil far from the limelight, but their calculations are feeding a roaring national debate over insurance premiums and the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Why Do Health Costs Keep Rising? These People Know
headline.print_headline: Spirited Debate Over U.S. Health Care Costs Has Its Cheerleaders: Actuaries

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
